Source

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • Source.Cell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CellInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GooseCell, TeleportCell, TrapCell, WaitCell

    public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
implements CellInterface
    Cell is the class that represents a Cell.

    A Cell is characterized by the following informations :

    • An index, which represents its position on the board
    • A player, which represents the player actually on the cell

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Leo JUMEL et Brice NUZZO

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeLeftNow()
      Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.

      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the player currently occupying this cell, null if none.
      int handleMove(int diceThrow)
      Returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when he reaches this cell.
      boolean isBusy()
      Indicates if a player currently occupies this cell.
      boolean isRetaining()
      Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.
      void welcome(Player player)
      Remembers player to be in this cell.

    • Method Detail

      • canBeLeftNow

        public boolean canBeLeftNow()
        Indicates if a player occupying this cell can, at this turn, leave the cell.
        Specified by:
        canBeLeftNow in interface CellInterface
        Returns:
        true if and only if the player in this cell can freely leaves the cell at this turn

      • isRetaining

        public boolean isRetaining()
        Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell.
        Specified by:
        isRetaining in interface CellInterface
        Returns:
        true if and only if the only way for a player to get out of this cell is for another player to replace him

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Indicates the position in the board of this cell.
        Specified by:
        getIndex in interface CellInterface
        Returns:
        a number greater than or equal to 0 (for the starting cell only).

      • handleMove

        public int handleMove(int diceThrow)
        Returns the index of the cell really reached by a player when he reaches this cell. For normal cells, the returned value equals getIndex() and is thus independent from diceThrow.
        Specified by:
        handleMove in interface CellInterface
        Parameters:
        diceThrow - the result of the dice when the player reaches this cell
        Returns:
        the index of the cell effectively reached when a player reaches this cell after the given throw of dice

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Indicates if a player currently occupies this cell.
        Specified by:
        isBusy in interface CellInterface
        Returns:
        true if and only if a player is in this cell*

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Returns the player currently occupying this cell, null if none.
        Specified by:
        getPlayer in interface CellInterface
        Returns:
        the player currently in this cell, null if none.

      • welcome

        public void welcome(Player player)
        Remembers player to be in this cell.
        Specified by:
        welcome in interface CellInterface
        Parameters:
        player - the new player in this cell
